intro: Glyptopetalum remotinervium, commonly known as the narrow-veined rock heath, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, leathery leaves with distinctive, narrow veins. Its flowers are typically pink or white, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom in spring. Glyptopetalum remotinervium is often found in rocky or forested habitats at high elevations.
